t: Matthew 22
The Parable of the Wedding Banquet
Once*p more Jesus spoke to them in parables:
“The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r a*r king*r who*r gave*r a*r wedding*r banquet*r for*r his*r son.*r
He*r sent*r his*r servants*r to*r summon*r those*r invited*r to*r the*r banquet,*r but*r they*r didn’t*r want*r to*r come.*r

Again,*r he*r sent*r out*r other*r servants*r and*r said,*r ‘Tell*r those*r who*r are*r invited:*r See,*r I’ve*r prepared*r my*r dinner;*r my*r oxen*r and*r fattened*r cattle*r have*r been*r slaughtered,*r and*r everything*r is*r ready.*r Come*r to*r the*r wedding*r banquet.’*r
“But*rp they*r paid*r no*r attention*r and*r went*r away,*r one*r to*r his*r own*r farm,*r another*r to*r his*r business,*r
while*r the*r rest*r seized*r his*r servants,*r mistreated*r them,*r and*r killed*r them.*r
The*r king*r was*r enraged,*r and*r he*r sent*r out*r his*r troops,*r killed*r those*r murderers,*r and*r burned*r down*r their*r city.*r
“Then*rp he*r told*r his*r servants,*r ‘The*r banquet*r is*r ready,*r but*r those*r who*r were*r invited*r were*r not*r worthy.*r
Go*r then*r to*r where*r the*r roads*r exit*r the*r city*r and*r invite*r everyone*r you*r find*r to*r the*r banquet.’*r
So*r those*r servants*r went*r out*r on*r the*r roads*r and*r gathered*r everyone*r they*r found,*r both*r evil*r and*r good.*r The*r wedding*r banquet*r was*r filled*r with*r guests.*r
When*r the*r king*r came*r in*r to*r see*r the*r guests,*r he*r saw*r a*r man*r there*r who*r was*r not*r dressed*r for*r a*r wedding.*r
So*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Friend,*r how*r did*r you*r get*r in*r here*r without*r wedding*r clothes?’*r The*r man*r was*r speechless.*r

“Then*rp the*r king*r told*r the*r attendants,*r ‘Tie*r him*r up*r hand*r and*r foot,*r and*r throw*r him*r into*r the*r outer*r darkness,*r where*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.’*r
“For*rp many*r are*r invited,*r but*r few*r are*r chosen.”*r
God and Caesar
Then*p the Pharisees went and plotted how to trap him by what he said.

So they sent their disciples to him, along with the Herodians. “Teacher,” they said, “we know that you are truthful and teach truthfully the way of God. You don’t care what anyone thinks nor do you show partiality.
Tell us, then, what you think. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
Perceiving*p their malicious intent, Jesus said, “Why*r are*r you*r testing*r me,*r hypocrites?*r
Show*r me*r the*r coin*r used*r for*r the*r tax.”*r They brought him a denarius.
“Whose*r image*r and*r inscription*r is*r this?”*r he asked them.
“Caesar’s,”*p they said to him. Then*p he said to them, “Give,*r then,*r to*r Caesar*r the*r things*r that*r are*r Caesar’s,*r and*r to*r God*r the*r things*r that*r are*r God’s.”*r
When they heard this, they were amazed. So they left him and went away.
The Sadducees and the Resurrection
That*p same day some Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came up to him and questioned him:
“Teacher, Moses said, if*i a*i man*i dies,*i having*i no*i children,*i his*i brother*i is*i to*i marry*i his*i wife*i and*i raise*i up*i offspring*i for*i his*i brother.*i
Now there were seven brothers among us. The first got married and died. Having no offspring, he left his wife to his brother.
The same thing happened to the second also, and the third, and so on to all seven.
Last of all, the woman died.
In the resurrection, then, whose wife will she be of the seven? For they all had married her.”
Jesus*p answered them, “You*r are*r mistaken,*r because*r you*r don’t*r know*r the*r Scriptures*r or*r the*r power*r of*r God.*r
For*r in*r the*r resurrection*r they*r neither*r marry*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage*r but*r are*r like*r angels*r in*r heaven.*r
Now*r concerning*r the*r resurrection*r of*r the*r dead,*r haven’t*r you*r read*r what*r was*r spoken*r to*r you*r by*r God:*r
I*ir am*ir the*ir God*ir of*ir Abraham*ir and*ir the*ir God*ir of*ir Isaac*ir and*ir the*ir God*ir of*ir Jacob?*ir He*r is*r not*r the*r God*r of*r the*r dead,*r but*r of*r the*r living.”*r
And*p when the crowds heard this, they were astonished at his teaching.
The Primary Commands
When*p the Pharisees heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, they came together.
And one of them, an expert in the law, asked a question to test him:
“Teacher, which command in the law is the greatest?”
He*p said to him, “Love*ir the*ir Lord*ir your*ir God*ir with*ir all*ir your*ir heart,*ir with*ir all*ir your*ir soul,*ir and*ir with*ir all*ir your*ir mind.*ir
This*r is*r the*r greatest*r and*r most*r important*r command.*r
The*r second*r is*r like*r it:*r Love*ir your*ir neighbor*ir as*ir yourself.*ir
All*r the*r Law*r and*r the*r Prophets*r depend*r on*r these*r two*r commands.”*r
The Question about the Messiah
While*p the Pharisees were together, Jesus questioned them,
“What*r do*r you*r think*r about*r the*r Messiah?*r Whose*r son*r is*r he?”*r They*p replied, “David’s.”
He*p asked them, “How*r is*r it*r then*r that*r David,*r inspired*r by*r the*r Spirit,*r calls*r him*r ‘Lord’:*r
The*irpn Lord*ir declared*ir to*ir my*ir Lord,*ir ‘Sit*irln at*ir my*ir right*ir hand*ir until*irln I*ir put*ir your*ir enemies*ir under*ir your*ir feet’?*ir
“If*rp David*r calls*r him*r ‘Lord,’*r how,*r then,*r can*r he*r be*r his*r son?”*r
No one was able to answer him at all, and from that day no one dared to question him anymore.
